intro: Beta vulgaris var. conditiva, commonly known as sugar beet, is a biennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy roots that store high concentrations of sucrose. The plant has large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically green with a hairy texture. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its cultivation is central to the global sugar industry.
